title: Luke Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Luke with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 24 chapters.

questions.question: Who was the priest of the course of Abia, married to Elisabeth?
questions.explanation: Zacharias was the priest married to Elisabeth, as described in Luke 1:5.

questions.question: What was the name of the angel who appeared to Zacharias?
questions.explanation: The angel Gabriel was sent to Zacharias to announce the birth of John the Baptist.

questions.question: What was Mary's response to the angel Gabriel's message?
options: She questioned how it could be
She accepted as the Lord's handmaid
questions.correctAnswer: She accepted as the Lord's handmaid
questions.explanation: Mary said, 'Behold the handmaid of the Lord; be it unto me according to thy word.'

questions.question: Who was the son born to Elisabeth and Zacharias?
questions.explanation: Elisabeth bore a son named John, who became John the Baptist.

questions.question: What city was Mary from?
questions.explanation: Mary was a virgin espoused to Joseph of Nazareth.

questions.question: What was the name of the prophetess who praised God after seeing the infant Jesus at the temple?
questions.explanation: Anna was a prophetess who gave thanks to God and spoke of the child Jesus to all.

questions.question: Where was Jesus born?
questions.explanation: Jesus was born in Bethlehem, fulfilling the prophecy about the Messiah's birthplace.

questions.question: What was the occupation of Joseph, Mary's husband?
questions.explanation: Joseph, the husband of Mary, was a carpenter by trade.

questions.question: At what age did Jesus stay behind in the temple, amazing the teachers?
questions.explanation: Jesus stayed in the temple at age twelve, discussing with teachers.

questions.question: What did John the Baptist eat while in the wilderness?
questions.explanation: John the Baptist lived on locusts and wild honey during his ministry in the wilderness.

questions.question: Who baptized Jesus?
questions.explanation: Jesus was baptized by John the Baptist in the Jordan River.

questions.question: What sign appeared after Jesus' baptism?
questions.explanation: The Holy Spirit descended like a dove upon Jesus after His baptism.

questions.question: How long was Jesus tempted in the wilderness?
questions.explanation: Jesus was tempted by the devil for forty days in the wilderness.

questions.question: What was Jesus' first recorded teaching in the synagogue at Nazareth?
options: The Spirit of the Lord is upon me
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit of the Lord is upon me
questions.explanation: Jesus read from Isaiah, proclaiming the Spirit of the Lord was upon Him.

questions.question: Which prophet's words did Jesus read in the synagogue in Nazareth?
questions.explanation: Jesus read from the book of Isaiah in the synagogue.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the people when Jesus read from Isaiah in the synagogue?
questions.explanation: The people marveled at His words but later rejected Him.

questions.question: What was Jesus' response to the people’s skepticism in Nazareth?
options: He cited examples of Elijah and Elisha
questions.correctAnswer: He cited examples of Elijah and Elisha
questions.explanation: Jesus referenced Elijah and Elisha performing miracles for Gentiles.

questions.question: What was the first miracle Jesus performed as recorded in Luke?
options: Healing a man with a withered hand
questions.explanation: Jesus cast out a devil from a man in the synagogue at Capernaum.

questions.question: Where did Jesus call His first disciples?
questions.explanation: Jesus called His first disciples by the Sea of Galilee.

questions.question: What profession did Simon Peter and Andrew have before following Jesus?
questions.explanation: Simon Peter and Andrew were fishermen before following Jesus.

questions.question: What did Jesus say to Simon Peter after the miraculous catch of fish?
options: Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men
questions.correctAnswer: Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men
questions.explanation: Jesus invited Simon Peter to follow Him and become a fisher of men.

questions.question: Who was the tax collector Jesus called to follow Him?
questions.explanation: Jesus called Matthew, a tax collector, to follow Him.

questions.question: What was Jesus’ response when questioned about eating with tax collectors and sinners?
options: They needed the physician, not the healthy
questions.correctAnswer: They needed the physician, not the healthy
questions.explanation: Jesus said, 'I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.'

questions.question: What did Jesus teach about new wine and old wineskins?
options: New wine must be put into new wineskins
New wine can go into old wineskins
Wine should not be stored in skins
questions.correctAnswer: New wine must be put into new wineskins
questions.explanation: Jesus taught that new wine must be put into new wineskins to preserve both.

questions.question: What parable did Jesus tell about the lost sheep?
options: A shepherd leaves ninety-nine to find one lost sheep
A farmer sows seed on good ground
A wise man builds his house on the rock
questions.correctAnswer: A shepherd leaves ninety-nine to find one lost sheep
questions.explanation: Jesus told the parable of the lost sheep who is sought until found.

questions.question: What is the main theme of the parable of the lost coin?
questions.explanation: The parable illustrates rejoicing when a lost sinner repents.

questions.question: What did the father do when his prodigal son returned home?
options: Ran to him and embraced him
questions.correctAnswer: Ran to him and embraced him
questions.explanation: The father warmly welcomed his repentant son back with a feast.

questions.question: According to Jesus, who is the greatest in the kingdom of God?
options: He who humbles himself as a little child
questions.correctAnswer: He who humbles himself as a little child
questions.explanation: Jesus taught that humility like a child's is greatness in God's kingdom.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the rich man and Lazarus in the afterlife?
options: The rich man suffered in hell while Lazarus was comforted
Both went to the same place
questions.correctAnswer: The rich man suffered in hell while Lazarus was comforted
questions.explanation: Jesus told a parable showing reversal of fortunes after death.

questions.question: What did Jesus teach about forgiveness and prayer in Luke 11?
options: Forgive others to be forgiven by God
questions.correctAnswer: Forgive others to be forgiven by God
questions.explanation: Jesus emphasized that forgiving others is essential to receive forgiveness.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And he said unto them, Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go unto him at midnight, and say unto him, Friend, lend me ______ loaves;'.
questions.explanation: Jesus used this example to teach persistence in prayer.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus declared that the Son of man is Lord of the Sabbath.
questions.explanation: Jesus stated this to affirm His authority over Sabbath laws.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus refused to heal on the Sabbath to avoid angering the Pharisees.
questions.explanation: Jesus healed a man with a withered hand on the Sabbath, challenging their understanding.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus taught to love your enemies and do good to those who hate you.
questions.explanation: Jesus' teaching in the Sermon on the Plain includes loving enemies.

questions.question: True or False: The parable of the Good Samaritan is found in the book of Luke.
questions.explanation: The parable is in Luke 10:25-37 teaching love and mercy.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told the parable of the unjust steward to teach dishonesty.
questions.explanation: Jesus used the parable to teach prudence and wise use of resources.

questions.question: True or False: Zacchaeus was a tax collector who climbed a sycamore tree to see Jesus.
questions.explanation: Zacchaeus climbed a tree to see Jesus and was saved.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus healed ten lepers, and all ten returned to thank Him.
questions.explanation: Only one leper returned to give thanks, a Samaritan.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told His disciples that the Kingdom of God cometh with observation.
questions.explanation: Jesus said the Kingdom of God is within you and does not come with observation.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus raised Lazarus from the dead in the book of Luke.
questions.explanation: The raising of Lazarus is recorded in John, not Luke.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus wept over Jerusalem because they rejected Him.
questions.explanation: Jesus wept over Jerusalem foretelling its destruction.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For the Son of man came to seek and to ______ that which was lost.'
questions.explanation: Jesus came to save the lost as in Luke 19:10.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Blessed are ye poor: for yours is the kingdom of ______.'
questions.explanation: Jesus pronounced blessings on the poor in spirit.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Judge not, and ye shall not be ______: condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned.'
questions.explanation: Jesus taught about mercy in judgment and forgiveness.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And he said unto them, Follow me, and I will make you ______ of men.'
questions.explanation: Jesus called His disciples to be fishers of men.
